result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Elijah Leon Roaf

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Elijah Leon Roaf in court.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court for Elijah Leon Roaf.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Final Pretrial held.  Parties remain in trial posture.  Any further motions will be heard on day of trial.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 11/7/2022 at 9:00 am, Courthouse Room 501.
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; State's Notice of Motion and Motion for Admission of 911 Recording
Received and Filed. State's Witness List
Received and Filed. State's Motion in Limine
Case set for a final pre-trial on 10/6/22 at 1:30 pm. Defense counsel is unavailable and requests an adjournment. Case is rescheduled to 10/14/22 at 1:30 pm. Parties notified.

Defendant Elijah Leon Roaf appeared by video.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn appeared by video for Elijah Leon Roaf.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Arraignment held.  Amended Complaint filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Defense counsel requests final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING  (14 pages) commencing 06-08-22 by TUCKER OSMAN.

Defendant Elijah Leon Roaf appeared by video.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court for Elijah Leon Roaf.  Prosecuting attorney Elaine B. Fehrs in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Calendar Call held.  Defendant in appearing, Court withdraws previously stayed bench warrant.  Court finds good cause to toll time limits.  State will e-file amended information at a later court date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Arraignment scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for an arraignment hearing. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Calendar call scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Elijah Leon Roaf in court with attorney Colin Patrick McGinn.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for arraignment. Court is in trial on another case and is unable to proceed on this matter. No spin courts are available. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Arraignment scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Elijah Leon Roaf in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg on behalf of Colin McGinn. Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for preliminary hearing. Preliminary hearing proceeded. Sworn for the State: Officer Michael Arango (MPD). State rests. Defense rests. Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Defense counsel requests an arraignment hearing. Case is adjourned to Branch 350  Arraignment scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SDT and JER.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Remaining cash bail posted to be returned to the remitter.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Elijah Leon Roaf in court with attorney Colin Patrick McGinn.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35. Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing. 
The Court reviewed the complaint and ordered the use of a dangerous weapon enhancer to be struck from counts 1 and 2. 
The Court found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. 
Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 35.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
